Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup - About this time our server pushed together another 2 top table against ours. With just the 2 of us ordering so much food, shit just got real. The soup had a good flavor and the chewy shrimp wontons were even better once I adorned them with a whole lot of chili paste. 

Beef Chow Fun - Greasy beefy and awesome! The noodles had a good amount of char and smoke flavor from a wok that's hot as hell. One thing to note is that the portion sizes here are huge and very sharable. 

At this point we were starting to hit the wall. We had chowed like it was our last meal though considering how hung over we were, it might as well have been. With this meal sitting in our bellies our hangovers started to subside. So another insight about KPK, a definite hang over cure.

excerpts: My last meal on Earth would be their roast duck over rice.
Good duck with drippings over perfectly done rice at Kam Po is one of my favorite things.
roast duck.author: John W.
roast duck.review:
My last meal on Earth would be their roast duck over rice. Good duck with drippings over perfectly done rice at Kam Po is one of my favorite things. I sometimes buy their whole large duck.

I like their roast pork as well. It has good flavor and is one of the better versions that I've found in Chinatown.

Besides the BBQ items it's also generally a good restaurant for Cantonese food.

excerpts: 4 stars on the ROAST DUCK.
roast duck.author: Belia P.
roast duck.review:
4 stars on the ROAST DUCK. 

The BBQ pork is not very good, I have had better. Garlic Chinese broccoli is ok, not very tasty. There is a soup that comes with your meal - put it over your rice!!

This place is like eating at home at your grandmas. Big Asian bowls and Chinese plates. It is not fancy at all - they are also a "pick up" and "to go" location. 

It is the BEST BANG for your buck. So much food for SO CHEAP!

excerpts: , we were able to order enough food for four people and order half a roast duck and BBQ pork for just under $50 and let me tell you I was stuffed.
roast duck.author: Zach C.
roast duck.review:
First off, this place isn't the cleanest, nor is the service the best but what it lacks in those two categories, it more than makes up for with it's food. I ate here the first weekend I moved here and have been going back whenever I am craving some good down to earth Chinese food. Not only is the food here good but it is extremely cheap as well, we were able to order enough food for four people and order half a roast duck and BBQ pork for just under $50 and let me tell you I was stuffed. 

You see many restaurants around china town with various roasted and barbecued meats hanging in the window, don't let that discourage you from going in, this is probably the best part of the restaurant. I've come by multiple times to grab a quick dinner or some barbecued meat to go and the taste/price of the food is enough to make me want to come back many more times.

excerpts: Lots of customers lined up for their roast duck and such.
Owner and workers been here for more then 20 yrs.
roast duck.author: Mar H.
roast duck.review: Prices have gone up like everything else here in Chinatown.  Roast meat still good.  Lots of customers lined up for their roast duck and such.  Owner and workers been here for more then 20 yrs.

excerpts: Had the roast duck, shrimp won ton soup, Hong Kong style fried noodles
roast duck.author: Mikey M.
roast duck.review: Amazing service, authentic, and inexpensive Chinese cuisine. Had the roast duck, shrimp won ton soup, Hong Kong style fried noodles

excerpts: Decent roast duck and beef chow fun.
Cash only.
Interior decor reminds me of 1940-1970's HK eatery.
roast duck.author: Maggie S.
roast duck.review: Decent roast duck and beef chow fun. Cash only. Interior decor reminds me of 1940-1970's HK eatery.

excerpts: I have never been a fan of roast duck, however, the duck here is phenomenal.
The best way to describe it is a hybrid peking and HK BBQ duck with thin crispy skin and flavorful juicy meat.
The preserved egg and pork congee was probably the best I've ever had.
It's also worth noting that the portions here are HUGE.
The burly construction worker sitting next to me filled up on one order of roast duck and rice before heading back to work.
Needless to say, I had delicious leftovers to bring home and enjoy the next day.
roast duck.author: Tiffany W.
roast duck.review:
Coming from LA, I used to always joke around that when you're in Chinatown, the health ratings all have different meanings. A = "Americanized," B = "Better," C = "Chinese. "  Keeping that in mind as I trekked down Broadway, I knew this place would be legit. Minimal decor, crowded seating area with mismatched chairs, and a somewhat questionable kitchen area. 

I forgot about all of these things as soon as the food arrived. Every bite I took brought me back to my summers in HK. I have never been a fan of roast duck, however, the duck here is phenomenal.  The best way to describe it is a hybrid peking and HK BBQ duck with thin crispy skin and flavorful juicy meat. The preserved egg and pork congee was probably the best I've ever had. It's also worth noting that the portions here are HUGE. The burly construction worker sitting next to me filled up on one order of roast duck and rice before heading back to work. Needless to say, I had delicious leftovers to bring home and enjoy the next day.

excerpts: I got a Roast duck wonton noodle soup $5 or so.
I got it with large rice noodles.
Some pieces of the duck were good, but others mostly bones & fat.
Wontons were small, some bok choy with the soup.
roast duck.author: Ann L.
roast duck.review:
Cash Only.  We went to Kam Po Kitchen for dinner Fri 11/26/10.  It's a hole-in-the-wall place in SF Chinatown on Powell St.

We were heading elsewhere, but have always to try this place & since it was in front of us we went in.

Food is cheap, but not all that great.

I got a Roast duck wonton noodle soup $5 or so.  I got it with large rice noodles.  Some pieces of the duck were good, but others mostly bones & fat.  Wontons were small, some bok choy with the soup.  Just ok.

B. got beef stew noodle soup about $5 - one piece of beef stew was tender, other pieces he said wasn't very tender.  He got egg noodle & like that ok.

B. ordered chicken feet about $5 - I thought they were pretty bad.  Not very tender, not enough flavor.  Skip it.

Someone ordered a plate of 1/2 roast chicken meat & 1/2 bbq pork over rice w/ side of veggies.  That looked good.

Another table tried to get chow fun - waitress said they ran out of chow fun!  That's strange.  They picked chow mein instead.

There's 1 unisex bathroom - didn't use it.

Before tip was $15.20.  Cash Only.

excerpts: Maybe the roast duck is better?
I guess on the plus side, it's cheap.
roast duck.author: Nei N.
roast duck.review:
After seeing this place packed full of people with delicious looking food, my friend and I spontaneously decided to eat lunch here. The portions were huge, and the food was cheap, but the food wasn't the best. 

We ordered a Beef Stew Flat Noodle Soup (Ngau Lam Tong Ho), a Wonton Noodle Soup, and a plate of Cha Siu. The Cha Siu was probably the best part of the meal. It was pretty lean, tender, and juicy. I thought it was seasoned pretty well with salt and savory spices, but it could have been sweeter. It didn't have that glistening glaze on the outside which was kind of a let down. 

From the outside windows, the noodles soups looked pretty good. It was the main reason why we got them. I could tell that the wontons were all shrimp just by peering through the glass. Despite the really slow service, I was still really excited to dig into my bowl when it arrived. When I took my first bite, my excitement quickly dwindled as the broth and noodles were so bland. The wontons really were all shrimp which is what you'd find in more desirable upscale wontons, but they also lacked any kind of seasoning. My friend's broth was similarly bland, and her beef was tough and flavorless. It was pretty disappointing all around. Maybe the roast duck is better? I guess on the plus side, it's cheap.

excerpts: Bomb roast duck wonton noodle soup.
Bowl was loaded and flavor was excellent.
Noodles were thin and chewy.
I'll be Back!
roast duck.author: Jack N.
roast duck.review: Bomb roast duck wonton noodle soup. Bowl was loaded and flavor was excellent. Noodles were thin and chewy. "I'll be Back!"

excerpts: The bf and I each got the roast duck (crispy skin + juicy meat + tasty sauce = orgasms in my mouth), which comes with a hearty portion of rice and veggies.
roast duck.author: Michele P.
roast duck.review:
Cheap and DELICIOUS--people do not come here for ambience or exceptional service.

Regardless of the latter, Kam Po deserves four stars for the nommy food alone. The bf and I each got the roast duck (crispy skin + juicy meat + tasty sauce = orgasms in my mouth), which comes with a hearty portion of rice and veggies. We also split the shrimp wonton soup, but it was so much food that we had leftovers.

A meal for two and a snack for later, for only $13.50??? We'll definitely be back! I'll try the BBQ pork next time, though it might be hard to pass up that scrumptious duck--but for ~$5 per meal, I'll probably end up just ordering and chowing down on both. :)

excerpts: We literally went in and ordered roast duck, roast pork, pig feet, chicken feet and steamed rice.
No funny business - just real down to earth good ole grub.
Happily satisfied with promises to come back.
roast duck.author: T C.
roast duck.review: We literally went in and ordered roast duck, roast pork, pig feet, chicken feet and steamed rice. No funny business - just real down to earth good ole grub. Happily satisfied with promises to come back.

excerpts: Ordered beef chow fun and roast duck.
The chow fun was dripping with grease and had no flavor.
The duck was ok.
Big portions but would not come back.
roast duck.author: Heather A.
roast duck.review: Ordered beef chow fun and roast duck. The chow fun was dripping with grease and had no flavor. The duck was ok. Big portions but would not come back.

excerpts: (They also serve a hefty shrimp dumpling and roast duck noodle soup here for a little over $6!
Screw Katana-ya.)
roast duck.author: Linus W.
roast duck.review: Affordable solid little no-frills chinese place specializing in roast and bbq meats it seems. Had a non-standard "hainan chicken" dish here ($6), along w/ some dou miao ($6.50) to balance out the meal. The chicken dish while tasty was closer to the canto "Bái qie ji", or poached chicken w/ a ginger-scallion-garlic oil sauce, on top of a bed of pickled vegetables. AFAIK, that is not the type of sauce one uses for hainanese chicken. The rice also was lighter flavored and colored; I'm told really good hainan chicken rice should have a nice yellow hue and be more strongly flavored of chicken. Still, the food is a great deal here; I wanna come back and try some of their jook. (They also serve a hefty shrimp dumpling and roast duck noodle soup here for a little over $6! Screw Katana-ya.)

excerpts: First off the roast duck is just such a guilty pleasure.
Wonderfully fatty and tasty with the most perfectly crispy and succulent skin.
Order it over rice
and you can easily split it into 2 meals.
The roast duck in wonton noodle soup is also one of my favorite hangover cures.
roast duck.author: Jon L.
roast duck.review:
If you're looking for the best roast meats in Chinatown, hands-down it's probably found at Kam Po Kitchen. In fact, rumor has it that they provide the roast meats for several other eateries around. 

I believe it's almost 4 years to the day that I stumbled upon Kam Po. I had just moved to the city and got lost in the labyrinth that is Chinatown at night but it was a most fortuitous detour since I found my go-to Chinese roast house. 

First off the roast duck is just such a guilty pleasure. Wonderfully fatty and tasty with the most perfectly crispy and succulent skin. Order it over rice and you can easily split it into 2 meals. The roast duck in wonton noodle soup is also one of my favorite hangover cures. The plump wontons and the warm soup work in tandem with the duck to get me out of my funk. 

If you've never seen a whole roasted pig come out of the roaster then you need to get here. It truly is a sight to behold when they bring the whole perfectly roasted hog out and hang it on display for all to see. What's impressive is they actually go through more than a pig a day. But wait till you bite into it. The crispy skin is perfection - the kind of thing that makes Anthony Bourdain salivate on camera. 

I've had other dishes here ranging from salted fish fried rice to dry fried beef chowfun and they are all decent but the real stars at Kam Po are without a doubt their roast meats. Considering that meals here are so inexpensive (most average around the $5 mark) though, it's hard to order something wrong.

The service is fast and earnest here especially the lady with the short cropped hair. She is a star here and runs a very tight ship. She negates the attitude from the grumpy butcher.  Don't come here for the ambiance. It's a dive. Order take out if you're afraid of the place but trust me you won't regret it. The food at Kam Po is truly yummy.

excerpts: Kam po is hands down the best roast duck in SF.
I can't go to Chinatown without coming here.
Duck heaven.
roast duck.author: Junel S.
roast duck.review: My first review was simply a complaint on the wait. Kam po is hands down the best roast duck in SF. I can't go to Chinatown without coming here. Duck heaven.

excerpts: For $4.95 I got a pretty good bowl of roast duck and wonton noodle soup.
Also, keep in mind that this is a Chinese BBQ place where the "star attraction" is the roast duck.
Therefore don't expect a super-clean place.
roast duck.author: H K.
roast duck.review:
I returned here for lunch last week due to some field work in the area.  The menu now still shows a lot of Chinese BBQ rice or noodle soup dishes for under $5 before tax and tip.  For $4.95 I got a pretty good bowl of roast duck and wonton noodle soup.

The waitress who served me was quite nice, a plus for a restaurant like this.  I recall it wasn't as busy as previous times I came for lunch (don't recall if it was because it was a later hour like after 1pm).  That was good for me because in the past during very busy hours the service can become very disorganized (especially when there's also a line of people ordering Chinese BBQ for takeout).

Also, keep in mind that this is a Chinese BBQ place where the "star attraction" is the roast duck.  Therefore don't expect a super-clean place.

excerpts: I started scoping out what the 99% Chinese patrons and 1% smart tourists had on their tables and kept going back to the roast duck that an older gentleman seemed to be greatly relishing.
roast duck.author: Valeria R.
roast duck.review:
Hot diggity duck!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0Yw-OWhZAU8BI852cx21ug?select=4pgA69Ao2Eth6PuchWOdXQ

I'd dropped into Kam Po several times over the past few years to pick up components for dinner, such as some chopped up roast pork or a box of steamed rice, but I had never tried anything off the menu.

I finally had my chance when I was working nearby yesterday. I walked in at lunchtime and stopped in my tracks...why had I never noticed before that the big menu on the wall is only in Chinese?

I started scoping out what the 99% Chinese patrons and 1% smart tourists had on their tables and kept going back to the roast duck that an older gentleman seemed to be greatly relishing.

Wow. So incredibly flavorful. The accompanying steamed cabbage and white rice picked up the wonderfully rich brown sauce from the duck, and the duck itself was moist, tender, fatty goodness.

I came thisclose to stopping back in later for another order for dinner but decided to wait. I'll leave the memory of that velvety duck percolating in my mind for another few days...let the anticipation build up. That way it'll feel like the first time all over again.

excerpts: Went on a food run here today and got the Roast Duck over rice to-go.
It was only $4.75!
which, for roast duck is as cheap as you can get.
The duck was not just skin and bones like other places I've had it
and the butcher actually gives you good portion sizes.
roast duck.author: Albert L.
roast duck.review:
IF POLICE OFFICERS EAT HERE, THEN YOU KNOW IT MUST BE GOOD.

Went on a food run here today and got the Roast Duck over rice to-go. It was only $4.75! which, for roast duck is as cheap as you can get. The duck was not just skin and bones like other places I've had it and the butcher actually gives you good portion sizes. It's topped off with some steamed cabbage and soy sauce that soaks in with the rice magically.

There's also other poultry that looks mouth watering so I'll have to come back soon! Too bad they don't have any hot sauce.. I'm not too fond of the oily chili flakes but can't blame em.

excerpts: Char siu and roast duck are both great here.
When you get it to go
they fill up a whole box with rice, throw some veggies on the side, and load it up with greasy meat.
Perfect for anybody on a budget.
roast duck.author: Harry T.
roast duck.review:
Key word is CHEAP but quality is not sacrificed

Rice plate with choice of BBQ item is $5. Not $5 and some change, just $5. Char siu and roast duck are both great here. When you get it to go they fill up a whole box with rice, throw some veggies on the side, and load it up with greasy meat. Perfect for anybody on a budget.

excerpts:
I think of the Roast Duck every night and day
The Roast Duck took my heart and the Suckling Pig took my pride away
I hate myself for loving the Suckling Pig
Can't break free from the things that you do
I wanna walk 
but I run back to your Roast Duck over rice to-go.
That's why I hate myself for loving your HK BBQ duck 
Daylight, spent the night without your Roast Polk
But I've been dreamin' 'bout the lovin' 
the Suckling Pig
I won't be as angry 'bout the hell you put me through
Hey, man, bet you can treat me right
You just don't know what you was missin' last night
I wanna 
see your face and say forget it just for spite
I think of the Suckling Pig every night and day
It took my heart and it took my pride away
roast duck.author: Nobu K.
roast duck.review:
Oh Hell Yes! WTF?
This is so deep shit!
Must to get the HK style BBQ duck because, thin crispy skin and flavorful juicy meat.

I hate myself for loving the Kam Po!

Midnight, gettin' uptight, where are you?
You said you'd meet me, now it's quarter to two
I know I'm hangin' but I'm still wantin' the Suckling Pig
Hey, Kam Po, it's a fact they're talkin' in town
I turn my back and you're messin' around
I'm not really jealous, don't like lookin' like a clown
I think of the Roast Duck every night and day
The Roast Duck took my heart and the Suckling Pig took my pride away
I hate myself for loving the Suckling Pig
Can't break free from the things that you do
I wanna walk but I run back to your Roast Duck over rice to-go.
That's why I hate myself for loving your HK BBQ duck 
Daylight, spent the night without your Roast Polk
But I've been dreamin' 'bout the lovin' the Suckling Pig
I won't be as angry 'bout the hell you put me through
Hey, man, bet you can treat me right
You just don't know what you was missin' last night
I wanna see your face and say forget it just for spite
I think of the Suckling Pig every night and day
It took my heart and it took my pride away
I hate myself for loving the 1/2 roast chicken meat & 1/2 bbq pork over rice 

I hate myself for loving Kam Po!

..... shit, I feel like I am seriously drugged by tons of msg ..... and going to Hell .... tomorrow morning, ...... hope I can still wake up,..... and take a shit .... if I could ,... it'll be A bomb. Did you know that HK style bbq duck gets me a big bomb every next morning. every time I said my self, "I hate myself for eating the shit!!!"
I will be dying, on X'mas day.

Up date, I'm still alive! Merry X'mas!

excerpts: To be truly honest, the roast duck is right on, it's juicy and fragrant.
roast duck.author: Ann Hui Y.
roast duck.review:
To me this is as comforting as it gets; wonton noodle soup, duck noodle soup, you name it, you got it! To be truly honest, the roast duck is right on, it's juicy and fragrant. Good place for a quick lunch and with the crazy hilltop winds, you're served with a cup of hot Chinese tea, and i mean HOT! 

Maybe the place doesn't look much, but it has that hong kong old coffee house vibes, somewhere to get a great and easy bite without having to put on a suit. Parking might be a little bit of a pain, but if you want great food, then you'll probably just have to find one to stop by.

excerpts: The roast duck and barbecue pork over rice is delicious and best deal at $8.50.
It's a typical loud Chinese restaurant with dodgy
hygiene
but it's what it is.
Authentic hole in the wall.
roast duck.author: N A.
roast duck.review: The roast duck and barbecue pork over rice is delicious and best deal at $8.50. It's a typical loud Chinese restaurant with dodgy hygiene but it's what it is. Authentic hole in the wall.

excerpts: Get a whole roast duck or a $5 duck plate lunch; and if you're that big of a wimp, take it to go.
You won't regret it.
roast duck.author: Matt S.
roast duck.review:
Look, it's Chinatown.  You're not going to Chinatown for ambiance or cleanliness (unless that ambiance is greasy counters and bad service).  You're going specifically to Kam Po for the amazing duck.  I have the distinct suspicion that anyone that's complaining about the cleanliness has never been to foreign countries and ate at the local street-food-type establishments.  I mean, that's why you're in Chinatown in the first place, right?  Authenticity?

As for the people complaining that the food there isn't that good, I have no idea about the other food there because I only go for the duck.  Just like I only go to McDonald's for a Big Mac not dessert and I only go to Peet's for coffee and not lunch.  I don't know why people would go to a place known for its duck and order beef and broccoli.  

Get a whole roast duck or a $5 duck plate lunch; and if you're that big of a wimp, take it to go.  You won't regret it.

excerpts: Roast duck is what I refer to as "O.G Duck" (Original Gansta Duck) since it's the first kind I ever had.
Super flavorful, delicious, moist, everything chinese roast duck should embody.
I was ordering half a roast duck to go.
I walk in, say hello.
Three guys, include the butcher, look up.
No response.
The waiter goes back to filling tea kettles.
The dishwashers continue washing.
The butcher goes back to putting lids on condiment containers full of sauce.
If y'all know of anywhere that does Roast Duck better, holla at me.
roast duck.author: Carmen K.
roast duck.review:
Okay so I am pretty much a fanatic of all things duck. Roast duck is what I refer to as "O.G Duck" (Original Gansta Duck) since it's the first kind I ever had. I've been eating it since I was a wee munchkin and have experienced very awesome versions and not so awesome version. 

Kam Po had the former - the duck was succulent, wasn't just bone and skin like some places (although I'll never turn down duck skin, let's be real). It was greasy, yes, but wasn't overly so. Super flavorful, delicious, moist, everything chinese roast duck should embody. 

Here's where 2 stars (and potentially three) were deducted. I walked in at 7pm on a Saturday. The restaurant was somewhat busy but there were a few tables open. Everyone was already eating already so in theory, I should have been helped right away right? 

WRONG. 

I was ordering half a roast duck to go. I walk in, say hello. Three guys, include the butcher, look up. No response. The waiter goes back to filling tea kettles. The dishwashers continue washing. The butcher goes back to putting lids on condiment containers full of sauce. NO ONE ACKNOWLEDGES ME. 

I literally watched the butcher put lids on 30 sauce containers ( I know bc I had enough time to count all them) and then he started putting them away in a box before I cleared my throat loudly and asked to be helped. 

At that point it was pretty smooth sailing (minus some english/chinese language barriers). Regardless, I understand when you go to Chinatown, especially one known for FOOD, you will get shitty service. This is to be expected. But at least when I walk into most places, they acknowledge your existence. Jesus. 

Anyway, I will go back maybe but will continue to shop around. If y'all know of anywhere that does Roast Duck better, holla at me.

excerpts: Roast Duck = Pretty good.
I'm more of a fan of the Beijing-style roast duck with the crispy skin than this kind, where the skin is soggy from sweet and sour sauce.
roast duck.author: Roy C.
roast duck.review:
This is my new favorite Cantonese restaurant in SF. It reminds me so much of the dirty and grungy restaurants that I frequented when I lived in China -- none of which would ever pass a standard health inspection, but all of which are always crowded because of authentic, delicious Chinese food at outrageously low prices.

If you can stomach the unsanitary environment (including very questionable silverware -- e.g., deep brown stains on white soup spoons) and don't mind stuffing yourself into a crowded, loud space (during weekend lunch rush hours), then you're in for quite a treat at Kam Po. 

I'm actually surprised at how good the service is here -- on the surface, Kam Po should have the laughably-horrible customer service that we've all come to accept and love from Chinatown restaurants. The two waitresses were unbelievably busy, but always made time to come fill up our tea and bring us whatever we wanted. They even cracked a smile once or twice.

The most entertaining spectacle of the restaurant, however, is the butcher behind the counter, elevated as if on a stage. This is someone who possesses a razor-sharp butcher knife as an extension of his arm, slicing and chopping through pork ribs and duck necks in a way that looked strangely artistic. You could imagine a Beethoven symphony playing in the background as he beautifully butchers the back bones of a suckling pig. Benihana performances ain't got nothing on Kam Po. 

--------------------------------------

FOOD:

Roast Pork = Incredible. The skin was perfectly crispy and the meat was unbelievably tender and juicy. We got there a little late, so the meat was a little cold from hanging on the hook throughout the morning, but the juiciness wasn't compromised in any way. I can only imagine how delicious it must be immediately after cooking.

Roast Duck = Pretty good. I'm more of a fan of the Beijing-style roast duck with the crispy skin than this kind, where the skin is soggy from sweet and sour sauce. The meat was very tender, but I just don't really like having it drenched in so much sauce.

Preserved Egg & Pork Porridge = Possibly the best preserved egg porridge I've had in San Francisco. There are so many full flavors packed into this porridge that it makes every bite delicious.

Garlic Sauteed Pea Shoots = Loved it. It's a little oily, but the garlic flavors explode with each bite. The pea shoots are very nicely stir-fried, without being overcooked like they usually are. Keep in mind that it's actually pretty-hilariously written in Chinglish as "Garlic Pea Sharts" on the menu. I want to give Kam Po an extra star just for that.

Total: $20 after tax & tip. Yes, it was seriously that cheap.

--------------------------------------

Kam Po is like a wonderful slice of the true Chinese neighborhood experience. I've tried many restaurants and delis in Chinatown whose food is comparable to (and probably even better than) that of Kam Po, but Kam Po definitely delivers the full experience that I love most about Chinese restaurants.

excerpts: The best roast duck and roast pork in Chinatown.
The Chow fun and HK style pan fried noodles (chow mein) are top notch too.
roast duck.author: Paul L.
roast duck.review: The best roast duck and roast pork in Chinatown. The Chow fun and HK style pan fried noodles (chow mein) are top notch too. Very good Wonton, meaty morsels wrapped in just the right thickness of Wonton skin. Atmosphere for dining is undesirable, prefer to order to go. The food is actually deserving of 4.5 star rating.

excerpts: This time, roast duck over rice and bitter melon and beef pan fried noodles - $9.80!
roast duck.author: Gloria H.
roast duck.review:
Still a fan.  Last meal there was ok - soup noodle was lacking a little flavor but you still can't beat the price, portion and speed.  

For the first time, we ordered stuff to go.  We called to order soy sauce chicken over rice and a beef chow fun to go on our way home and they were ready when we got there less than 10 minutes later...here's the topper, $8.90!  2 orders including tax - $8.90!  Crazy.  It was damn good too. 

We ordered to go again.  This time, roast duck over rice and bitter melon and beef pan fried noodles - $9.80!  Still under $10!  

Fast, cheap, large portion...this is the place.

excerpts: Kam Po is definitely my go-to spot when I'm hankering for roast duck, roast pork, bbq pork, or any other culinary treat that can be hooked and dangled in front of a window.
In particular the roast duck wonton noodle soup is my favorite in the city.

The wontons are super flavorful, perfect ration of meat to wrapper without that weird gummy consistency, and don't make me feel like I'm eating dumpling bought from Costco; and they are definitely not at all skimpy on the roast duck portion which is more than generous.
roast duck.author: David H.
roast duck.review:
There are two things for certain when coming to Kam Po: 1) you'll probably be eating at a greasy-looking table wiped down by a towel about 3 months past its prime; 2) the food will be ridiculously good. So if you can overlook #1 (when did we all become such sissies in SF?), then you're in for a treat.

Kam Po is definitely my go-to spot when I'm hankering for roast duck, roast pork, bbq pork, or any other culinary treat that can be hooked and dangled in front of a window. In particular the roast duck wonton noodle soup is my favorite in the city. The wontons are super flavorful, perfect ration of meat to wrapper without that weird gummy consistency, and don't make me feel like I'm eating dumpling bought from Costco; and they are definitely not at all skimpy on the roast duck portion which is more than generous.

Kam Po is one of those places that actually feels and looks like what one would imagine to be an authentic Chinatown restaurant.

Looking forward to my next bowl of soup!

excerpts: The Roast Duck, Roast Pork and Soy Sauce
roast duck.author: Peter L.
roast duck.review:
Kam Po Kitchen's updated their menus for 2010 (see pictures) and now includes clay pot Porridges and clay pot rices.

The prices are a tad higher than before but it's still a great place to go for $5-6! I've never eaten here, but we always order stuff to go every week all year long! Although it can take 30 minutes before it's ready, the clay pot rice dishes are excellent. Their porridges are always a good choice to warm your body.

The Roast Duck, Roast Pork and Soy Sauce Chickens great choices for when you're to lazy to prepare the "meat" at home.

Other favorites include: Singapore Style Vermicelli, Beef with Scramble Eggs over rice and Beef Stew Won Ton Noodle Soup

excerpts: I ordered the roast duck and beef chow fun.
The beef chow fun
lasted me at least 3 meals.
Really greasy, but super worth the $4.30 I paid.
The roast duck was probably drenched in sodium, but it was still pretty good with the rice underneath.
Also less than $5.
roast duck.author: Adele Z.
roast duck.review:
This place is a true Chinatown hole in the wall that has CHEAP food in remarkably large quantities. 4 stars for the large quantity and cheapness, 3 stars for the food taste.

I ordered the roast duck and beef chow fun. The beef chow fun lasted me at least 3 meals. Really greasy, but super worth the $4.30 I paid. The roast duck was probably drenched in sodium, but it was still pretty good with the rice underneath. Also less than $5. What a steal.

Atmosphere is very grungy-esque, but still, lots of people on a Tuesday evening.

excerpts: A Chinatown staple for roast pork, roast duck and bbq pork.
Each of the meats were tender and flavorful.
They are familiar to my taste buds and comforting to my tummy.
The bbq meat order comes with a huge serving of rice, meat and veggies.
They will ladle sauce over it.
Cheap comfort food that opens til 8 pm.
roast duck.author: Eve C.
roast duck.review: So cheap and good. A Chinatown staple for roast pork, roast duck and bbq pork. Each of the meats were tender and flavorful. They are familiar to my taste buds and comforting to my tummy. The bbq meat order comes with a huge serving of rice, meat and veggies. They will ladle sauce over it. Cheap comfort food that opens til 8 pm.

excerpts: I ordered the rice with roast duck.
It was awesome!
Very tender and flavorful duck.
The meal also came with soup and some cabbage.
roast duck.author: Susan P.
roast duck.review: I ordered the rice with roast duck.  It was awesome!  Very tender and flavorful duck.  The meal also came with soup and some cabbage.  My mom got the rice with roast pork.  It was good, but can't compete with the duck.  Service was good.  Everyone else dining there was Chinese. Seems like an authentic place.

excerpts: Now I'm craving their "syu yok ap fan" (BBQ roast pork, roast duck combo rice plate lunch) and it's 1AM!!
What do I do now?!
Can't wait till tomorrow lunch.
GOOD FOOD.
nuff said.
roast duck.author: George F.
roast duck.review: Like eating at grandma's house. Everything fresh, piping hot, delicious, home cooked traditional Cantonese "comfort food." Inexpensive, fast, real. Consistent over the years. Their Cantonese BBQ is one of the best. Eaten here hundreds of times with my fam and friends and NEVER DISAPPOINTED. Good food, Aww shoot. Now I'm craving their "syu yok ap fan" (BBQ roast pork, roast duck combo rice plate lunch) and it's 1AM!! What do I do now?! Can't wait till tomorrow lunch. GOOD FOOD. nuff said.

excerpts:
Cleanliness : -2.5 stars (another minus)
Roast Duck over rice :  10 stars (a TEN?

The grandmas and grandpas in chinatown who frequent this joint don't seem to mind the presentation but they definitely won't tolerate anything that is less than perfect roast duck, roast pork, BBQ pork, or won ton noodle.
At least that is my theory as to why their signature food is so good.
roast duck.author: perry h.
roast duck.review:
Ambiance : -2.5 stars  (yes, minus 2.5)
Cleanliness : -2.5 stars (another minus)
Roast Duck over rice :  10 stars (a TEN? yes, indeed...)

So, they add up to 5 stars. 

This is one of those hole-in-the wall in SF chinatown that offer generous portion of authentic cantonese food for a bargain.  The grandmas and grandpas in chinatown who frequent this joint don't seem to mind the presentation but they definitely won't tolerate anything that is less than perfect roast duck, roast pork, BBQ pork, or won ton noodle.  At least that is my theory as to why their signature food is so good.

excerpts: We had: roast pork and rice, roast duck noodle soup, and beef and tofu over rice.
The beef and tofu was average, but the roast meat items were standouts.
Looking around, I knew the place was legit because we were surrounded by old Chinese people.
Each item was less than $5.
Service was super fast, though not exactly friendly.
roast duck.author: Jennifer K.
roast duck.review:
Quintessential hole in the wall...and it was delicious. 

We had: roast pork and rice, roast duck noodle soup, and beef and tofu over rice. The beef and tofu was average, but the roast meat items were standouts. Looking around, I knew the place was legit because we were surrounded by old Chinese people.  Each item was less than $5. Service was super fast, though not exactly friendly. Whatever though, you come to this place for the food - especially the roasted meats. 

Can't wait to come back again!

excerpts: The broth on the soup was awesome, the wontons were good (not great because I have had better but for 4 bucks what can you say), the roast pork and roast duck were killer!!!
roast duck.author: jason g.
roast duck.review:
hahahahah...........this has to go to my list of 5 star food at 1 star places.  I haven't been here since I was a kid.  

I came here with my old roommate because it was close by and the food here is good and cheap.  I think I saw an order on the menu that was around 2.60.  I couldn't believe my eyes.  As for the food, it is pretty damn good for a hole in a wall Chinatown restaurant.  The broth on the soup was awesome, the wontons were good (not great because I have had better but for 4 bucks what can you say), the roast pork and roast duck were killer!!!

I need to start coming back to Chinatown to eat more often.  It's sorta an adventure when you haven't eaten here for a while.  I will definitely come back to this place.

excerpts: My friends and I always come here if we want some good roast duck or roast pork over rice.
roast duck.author: Jenny Y.
roast duck.review:
I love it here! My friends and I always come here if we want some good roast duck or roast pork over rice. Seriously, for $5 you can get that. 

This place is always PACKED! 

I remember I used to come here a lot when I was young, then I stopped because my mother got into the whole health trend. But now, screw that, I want me some crispy duck skin.

Here are a few tips if you decide to go to this restaurant:
1. Be aggressive. Don't wait around for them to notice you. Once they see you, let them know you are here and how many people you have.
2. Don't drink too much of the tea. I'm not saying the tea is dirty (it might be), but this will help you NOT use their bathroom.
3. The only things that should be ordered here are rice plates paired with some sort of roasted meat and crispy noodles.
4. Don't sit and chat with your friends like this is some sort of cafe. It's not. People around you will think you look stupid.
5. Bring your own bottle of water. 
6. Respect the waitress. She works here 7 days a week during all the hours that this restaurant is opened. She's the first one here and the last one to leave. Cut her some slack.

excerpts: Will be back to try their chicken and roast duck .
roast duck.author: Eileen L.
roast duck.review: Their roast pork and BBQ pork are both pretty good . Their chicken leg is not ... it's very dry and lacks flavor . Will be back to try their chicken and roast duck .

excerpts: Dirty little place, but they can make jook and wonton soup any way you want it, and their roast duck is sumptuous.
Very affordable prices.
Don't take skittish people here, though.
I haven't been back in a while, but this is the kind of place that stays precisely the same for years and years.
roast duck.author: Josh K.
roast duck.review: Dirty little place, but they can make jook and wonton soup any way you want it, and their roast duck is sumptuous. Very affordable prices. Don't take skittish people here, though. I haven't been back in a while, but this is the kind of place that stays precisely the same for years and years.

excerpts: Bbq pork and roast duck - hands down.
still no complaints!
Shrimp w/ scrambled egg chow fun - not bad.
Seafood chow fun - huge disappointment.
roast duck.author: Sue C.
roast duck.review:
Preserved egg w/ pork porridges - hands down. no complaints!
Bbq pork and roast duck - hands down. still no complaints!
Shrimp w/ scrambled egg chow fun - not bad. 
Seafood chow fun - huge disappointment. Not much flavor. 

Now, the bathroom.... quite disgusting and scary. But if you have been to China and survived, then you should be ok.

excerpts: I had the won ton soup with roasted BBQ pork (not bad, LOTS of pork but the broth was relatively flavorless) and the roast duck on rice.
roast duck.author: Alli J.
roast duck.review:
This place is no freaking joke. Whoa. 

I walked up and was thinking, man, you're really trying to impress me aren't you? Just kiddinggggggggg!

But yes, it's definitely a bare bones restaurant. I had the won ton soup with roasted BBQ pork (not bad, LOTS of pork but the broth was relatively flavorless) and the roast duck on rice. The duck was good and it was an extremely generous portion. 

You could definitely get by on a really really small budget by eating here. There was more than enough food leftover for dinner which basically means you could easily eat for 4 bucks a day if you so desired roast meat galore and rice as your sole diet.

excerpts: the roast duck  over rice is the bomb and only under 6 buck!!!!!
it is a little dirty but the food overcompensate the service and cleanness.
Some people would compelling of the service but this is the spot to eat real Chinese food
roast duck.author: janet l.
roast duck.review: this is the spot for Chinese food. the roast duck  over rice is the bomb and only under 6 buck!!!!! it is a little dirty but the food overcompensate the service and cleanness. Some people would compelling of the service but this is the spot to eat real Chinese food

excerpts: Roast duck was great!
Sweet and sour pork was great too!
roast duck.author: Johnatton L.
roast duck.review: Not as dirty as some had mentioned. Maybe they started to make an effort to clean up. Roast duck was great! Sweet and sour pork was great too!

excerpts: Everyone crams into this lunch joint b/c it's got some of the juiciest roast duck and pork in Chinatown
AND it's unbelievably cheap.
Just keep in mind
it's a hole-in-the-wall crammed with scrubby tables and a restroom you should pretend doesn't exist.
+ | Roast Duck / Pork
Order it any way you like (over rice, in soup, half/whole, to-go, etc.), as long as you try some of Kam Po's reknowned roast!
roast duck.author: Christina J.
roast duck.review:
Everyone crams into this lunch joint b/c it's got some of the juiciest roast duck and pork in Chinatown AND it's unbelievably cheap.  Just keep in mind it's a hole-in-the-wall crammed with scrubby tables and a restroom you should pretend doesn't exist.  Carry anti-bacterial, wipe down your utensils, chow down, then jet!

++ | Roast Duck / Pork |
Order it any way you like (over rice, in soup, half/whole, to-go, etc.), as long as you try some of Kam Po's reknowned roast!  Some people will ask for extra "duck sauce" (au jus) or ginger-garlic paste to taste.

++ | Rice Dishes |
Monstrous heap of rice w/any selection of the standard Cantonese sautés.

-- Noodle soups
Don't order any of the noodles! The soup base is bland and the noodles are grocery store boring.

A filling, quick and dirty lunch = $5/person

excerpts: But I do know they've got some of the best damn Roast Duck & Roast Pork in Chinatown because...

all I do is ask for a half order of Roast Duck & Roast Pork over steamed rice, TO GO, and the fellas grab the duck & pork off their respective hooks, place em on the cutting block, and do what I can only describe as... well...

all I do is ask for a half order of Roast Duck & Roast Pork over steamed rice, TO GO, and the fellas grab the duck & pork off their respective hooks, place em on the cutting block, and do what I can only describe as... well...
roast duck.author: John Eric S.
roast duck.review:
I'm not sure if Kam Po even has a menu printed in English. They certainly have lots of things written in Chinese taped up in their windows and along their walls.

And I have never eaten INSIDE the restaurant. Always ordered TO GO.

But I do know they've got some of the best damn Roast Duck & Roast Pork in Chinatown because... well... it's hanging right there in the window!

I don't think the fellas with the meat cleavers that work behind the counter speak much English, but we've developed an almost unspoken understanding over the years... all I do is ask for a half order of Roast Duck & Roast Pork over steamed rice, TO GO, and the fellas grab the duck & pork off their respective hooks, place em on the cutting block, and do what I can only describe as... well... *MAGIC* with that meat cleaver!

All this food & the show for just $6? That's one of the best deals in town, my friends.

excerpts: Keep with the rice plates - we got Roast Duck and BBQ Pork; great and only $4.75 (including soup).
The butcher is outstanding and the portion sizes are good.
Comes with steamed cabbage and good sauces.
Nice people.
Cash only.
roast duck.author: Brian C.
roast duck.review: Great place.  Keep with the rice plates - we got Roast Duck and BBQ Pork; great and only $4.75 (including soup).  The butcher is outstanding and the portion sizes are good.  Comes with steamed cabbage and good sauces.  Nice people.  Cash only.

excerpts: I came here on my lunch break and ordered the roast duck like everyone recommended.
It ended up in the trash and made my way over to Golden Boy.
roast duck.author: Mike S.
roast duck.review: This place is disgusting. I came here on my lunch break and ordered the roast duck like everyone recommended. It ended up in the trash and made my way over to Golden Boy.

excerpts: I always get the roast duck with rice or the roast pig with rice.
I could admit although, I have had better BBQ pork, I don't hate it or anything, I just don't like it.
I lived in Chinatown most of my life
and I have had
WAY better bb
pork/ roast pork/ and roast duck
but this place does the trick.
It is decent food for a very cheap price.
roast duck.author: Nelson Z.
roast duck.review:
This place is always full! The food is extremely cheap. Five dollars in your pocket? Well that gets you a meal that you could split into lunch AND dinner. I always get the roast duck with rice or the roast pig with rice. I could admit although, I have had better BBQ pork, I don't hate it or anything, I just don't like it. I lived in Chinatown most of my life and I have had WAY better bb pork/ roast pork/ and roast duck but this place does the trick. It is decent food for a very cheap price. I come here at least once a week.

4 stars just because its not all that clean or organized...

excerpts: Roast Pork/Roast Duck Combo!
$7.45 and well worth it.
It's always a bit cheaper when you get just one item alone but as a carnivore, the combo for me is a must.
What has me praising this place is the portions and pricing...
two things that pair together well when used right.
Look past the "greasy spoon" ambience at this place and try it out!
You're guaranteed to keep your tummy and your wallet full.
Great Food!
And for those of you adventerouse eaters...go ahead and try your hand at the pig intestines, or maybe some chicken feet, but the roast pork or duck here is the staple!
RECOMMENDED
roast duck.author: Marcel W.
roast duck.review: Roast Pork/Roast Duck Combo! $7.45 and well worth it. It's always a bit cheaper when you get just one item alone but as a carnivore, the combo for me is a must. What has me praising this place is the portions and pricing...two things that pair together well when used right. Look past the "greasy spoon" ambience at this place and try it out! You're guaranteed to keep your tummy and your wallet full. Great Food! And for those of you adventerouse eaters...go ahead and try your hand at the pig intestines, or maybe some chicken feet, but the roast pork or duck here is the staple! RECOMMENDED

excerpts: Roast duck, chow mein, and the clay pot menu are the best items, but dont take my word for it.
Just give it a try.
roast duck.author: Emilio B.
roast duck.review: Ill keep this short and sweet. The place looks a little questionable health code wise, but after closer inspection it seems like it might pass. The food on the other hand is undoubtedly fantastic. One of the gems of chinatown here in SF. I live one block away and this place is a consistent stop when wanting inexpensive, yet delicious food. Roast duck, chow mein, and the clay pot menu are the best items, but dont take my word for it. Just give it a try.

excerpts: This place has the best pork with crispy skin, and their Roast Duck is on par with the best in the Bay.
As if that's not enough, their prices are awesome for the generous proportions they give you.
I always stop by whenever I'm in the area!
roast duck.author: Donald F.
roast duck.review:
This place is a small hole in the wall with great food at very good prices!

This place has the best pork with crispy skin, and their Roast Duck is on par with the best in the Bay. As if that's not enough, their prices are awesome for the generous proportions they give you. I always stop by whenever I'm in the area!

excerpts:
I suggest sticking with the rice plates with the chicken, cha sieu, or  roast duck (because those are made fresh) 
10)
I come back once in a blue moon
roast duck.author: Emily L.
roast duck.review:
1) Super cheap (usually $3-$5) 
2) Super big portions 
3) I don't recommend drinking their soup because I found soggy newspapers in my soup once, and it makes me think they just pour whatever other customers don't finish back into the big pot and reserve
4) And because of #3, i don't think this place is necessarily sanitary 
5) Area is small
6) 0 ambiance
7) Rather crowded
8) Sometimes their food isn't all that fresh, i.e. the wontons 
9) I suggest sticking with the rice plates with the chicken, cha sieu, or  roast duck (because those are made fresh) 
10) I come back once in a blue moon

The people in there eating are legit Chinese ppl.
You may not like the ambience (it is Chinatown) and just know if you sit by yourself they like to do it family style
so some person(s) may just sit with you.
But don't worry, they really don't talk to you.
You get these HUGE portions and each dish is from under $4 to less than $7.

You may not like the ambience (it is Chinatown) and just know if you sit by yourself they like to do it family style so some person(s) may just sit with you.  But don't worry, they really don't talk to you.  You get these HUGE portions and each dish is from under $4 to less than $7.  This stuff is GOOD.

LEAN duck, what's the secret?
Unlike Cheung Hing's and a few others I could mention, Kam Po's really got the roast duck down to lucious, lean duckie goodness ...
it's like when you get a hunk of  crab claw meat on your Swan Oyster Depot salad
and you get a nice mouthful of pure "MEAT" and
it's culinary oral orgasm ...
*satisfied smile* then gourmand after glow ...
This was actually the 2nd day in a row I stopped by for roast duck on rice with roast pork for variety ... parking is such a bee-ach and those hot foods on display in the front are rather beckoning
but it's pretty much a HK barbecue charcuterie to go for me ... as far as dining in goes, well
yeah, decor leaves a lot to be desired but the prices offset that demerit
so it's still one of those San Francisco treasures and the place to grab roast ducks,

excerpts: I love their roast duck.
and their food is soooo cheap... they give you so much food, its insane!
roast duck.author: Janet S.
roast duck.review: Ive been going here since i was 9 years old when it was at their old location, which i guess is about 20 years.  they have had numerous owner and I think they finally have an owner that cares about cleaniness.  It stopped smelling like bleach.  their chinese bbq are the great.  I love their roast duck.  and their food is soooo cheap... they give you so much food, its insane!

excerpts: Any dish with the BBQ meats that are on display up front will be a tasty bargain - roast pork (crispy skin), BBQ pork (that's cha siu), and roast duck are the three main ones.
roast duck.author: Oh G.
roast duck.review:
This restaurant is the very definition of good, authentic, cheap Chinese food. I love the noodle soups but the full panoply of fast Cantonese rice and noodle dishes is available. Any dish with the BBQ meats that are on display up front will be a tasty bargain - roast pork (crispy skin), BBQ pork (that's cha siu), and roast duck are the three main ones.

The lady who seems to be there all the time is amazing - she doesn't need to write down your order and she always gets it right. She has amazing energy to keep going at all times of the day. She's my hero.

There's an English menu, but there's also Chinese language signs on the walls. I can read Chinese, but I've  never ordered the Chinese-only dishes - just because they feature things like frog and bitter melon that I really don't like anyway. If you want to be adventurous, tell her you want to try one of them - it won't cost much!

The place is small and the bare tables are packed in together with little elbow room. But that's part of the appeal, for me. No pretension, no creature comforts - just delicious cheap food.

excerpts: All I got was the roast duck and the BBQ pork, and both were good.
The duck was most likely fresh as it was a nice combination of fatty and crispy.
BBQ pork was about as good as I would expect from a BBQ place like this, nothing super extraordinary.
This is a hole in the wall type of joint where you can expect cheap food that has good quality.

Caveat: I have never actually gone into the restaurant (just dropped off people to pick up the duck), but I think this is probably the best way to go so that you can avoid both the hellish parking in the Chinatown area as well as the crowded restaurant.

BBQ pork was about as good as I would expect from a BBQ place like this, nothing super extraordinary.  This is a hole in the wall type of joint where you can expect cheap food that has good quality.  Caveat: I have never actually gone into the restaurant (just dropped off people to pick up the duck), but I think this is probably the best way to go so that you can avoid both the hellish parking in the Chinatown area as well as the crowded restaurant.  The roast pork looked good even from my car in the street so I am looking forward to going back to try that.

excerpts: And I being Vietnamese and eating authentic food,( Panda Express is good but like saying Taco Bell is Mexican food), decided to get some roast duck.
If it isn't hanging in the window you really have to wonder right?!
But
needless to say Kam Po is DELICIOUS!
I usually get the Roast Duck Won Ton Noodle.
You get a bunch of duck.
A bunch.
And it is tasty and filling and all for under $5.
Then to go
I get the rice, Roast Duck, and BBQ pork.
Its like getting 2 meals.
Lots of meat, great value and its quick.
Going there is ok
but the people who work there are not so english speaking.
But then the food makes it worth it.
My girlfriend and I ate there 3 times in three days before.
The beef and broccoli chow mein with the chinese broccoli is fantastic.
During lunch hours you see a wide variety of people stopping off to get food to go.
And its worth it.

excerpts: Preserved egg w/ pork porridges - hands down.
no complaints!
pork porridges.author: Sue C.
pork porridges.review:
Preserved egg w/ pork porridges - hands down. no complaints!
Bbq pork and roast duck - hands down. still no complaints!
Shrimp w/ scrambled egg chow fun - not bad. 
Seafood chow fun - huge disappointment. Not much flavor. 

Now, the bathroom.... quite disgusting and scary. But if you have been to China and survived, then you should be ok.

excerpts: I always get the roast duck with rice or the roast pig with rice.
I could admit although, I have had better BBQ pork, I don't hate it or anything, I just don't like it.
I lived in Chinatown most of my life
and I have had
WAY better bb
pork/ roast pork/ and roast duck
but this place does the trick.
It is decent food for a very cheap price.
roast duck with rice.author: Nelson Z.
roast duck with rice.review:
This place is always full! The food is extremely cheap. Five dollars in your pocket? Well that gets you a meal that you could split into lunch AND dinner. I always get the roast duck with rice or the roast pig with rice. I could admit although, I have had better BBQ pork, I don't hate it or anything, I just don't like it. I lived in Chinatown most of my life and I have had WAY better bb pork/ roast pork/ and roast duck but this place does the trick. It is decent food for a very cheap price. I come here at least once a week.

4 stars just because its not all that clean or organized...

excerpts: I ordered the Soy Sauce Chicken with Rice.
My boyfriend ordered BBQ Pork with Rice.
And we shared a Roasted Pork with Wanton Noodle Soup.
The portions were pretty decent and the price was right...only $19 for those three items.
Service was alright.
Cleanliness was probably not of the highest order.
This seemed like a pretty authentic style of cooking.
Out of all the items ordered, I liked the BBQ Pork the best -- I'd give that a 4/5 and would return for that.
I loved the way it was seasoned.
Soy Sauce Chicken was pretty good -- 3.5/5.
Neither one of us was super stoked about the soup.
It was nice to have some warm soup on a cold day.
And it wasn't bad.
But it wasn't a favorite either.
We both liked the BBQ pork the best.
I'd give the overall experience a 3.5 out of 5.
soy sauce chicken with rice.author: Renee F.
soy sauce chicken with rice.review: Good stuff! I ordered the Soy Sauce Chicken with Rice. My boyfriend ordered BBQ Pork with Rice. And we shared a Roasted Pork with Wanton Noodle Soup. The portions were pretty decent and the price was right...only $19 for those three items. Service was alright. Cleanliness was probably not of the highest order. This seemed like a pretty authentic style of cooking. Out of all the items ordered, I liked the BBQ Pork the best -- I'd give that a 4/5 and would return for that. I loved the way it was seasoned. Soy Sauce Chicken was pretty good -- 3.5/5. Neither one of us was super stoked about the soup. It was nice to have some warm soup on a cold day. And it wasn't bad. But it wasn't a favorite either. We both liked the BBQ pork the best. I'd give the overall experience a 3.5 out of 5.

excerpts: We got salt and pepper prawns, roast duck, cod with Chinese broccoli, American broccoli with garlic sauce and bbq pork fried rice.
bbq pork fried rice.author: Lei H.
bbq pork fried rice.review:
It is cheap for sure but you get what you pay for.  Food was okay but cheap.  We got salt and pepper prawns, roast duck, cod with Chinese broccoli, American broccoli with garlic sauce and bbq pork fried rice.  

Duck was greasy and unimpressive.  Waitress tried to push the half duck.  Thank god I didn't get it.    Prawns was tasty but overly oily.   Same with fish.  Western broccoli and fried rice was decent. 

I give it 3 stars for the price and speed of service.   Won't be back any time soon and definitely not for dinner again.  


Place feels not clean and there is no service to discuss - typical Chinese fast food service.
